answerText: commutator bracket[10] This principle can be explained by the fact that position and momentum obey a canonical commutation relation. It states that the product of the standard deviations of the measurements of position and momentum must be larger than h-bar over 2.

subject: Science
question: Question: This operation, which is only defined on a Hilbert space, is analogous to the Poisson bracket from Hamiltonian mechanics. For 10 points each: [10] Name this operation which for two operators A and B is simply defined as AB minus BA.
